title: I don't want a certain meta
body:
I want, "This guy is good at X champion so it does well"

I don't want "{{champion:79}} is really good right now just pick him." People need to be more open. If you're good at {{champion:113}} and enjoy her, play her, but don't play her just because you want to win, unless you find joy in that, in that case, go for it. If you like playing assassins top, then go for it dude, don't let that {{champion:120}} or {{champion:102}} stop you from doing you. If you want to play support {{champion:112}}, and it works for you, then do it. Don't just play {{champion:111}} because he's super strong.

A defining play style meta will be the death of this game. If you force Assassins in, then poke mages are gonna leave the game, if you force having an ADC hyper carry like {{champion:67}} and then 4 people to protect them, you're gonna make assassin players leave.


Stop trying to go with the flow. You won't be the next great player because you play flavor of the month champions. Do you really want to be "That guy as good as Faker" or somebody who people aspire to be. Don't be a follower, find what you like, and play it. I don't play full AD Kha'Zix and Nocturne because it wins games easy, I play them because I find it fun. Yeah, you can play tank Shyvana, _or you can play full AD Shyvana and burst people down like a baller._ 

What I'm trying to say is, do what you want to do. If you like playing tanks, then the meta just so happens to welcome you, but as soon as that meta shifts, keep playing those tanks. Don't be another follower, be the next leader. Don't aspire to do good in the current meta, do so well that you create the next meta. Don't copy LCS picks, do so well that LCS players want to copy you.

Do you.

They do decide it. It sure as hell isn't Riot.The best people in the world are emulated by everyone else. An example is tele/smite top shyv recently.

Lol.. actually it is riot.. They release new content and the meta changes to broken stuff, broken stuff is fastest discovered by the best players. Your misconception that it's made by the pros is just ludicrous lmao it's made by the patch changes... why else would the meta ever change if not for the patches ? bronze logic.

Like right now everyone thinks Khazix is bad.. Khazix is heavily played right now in high elo.. So is shaco lol.. they're not tanks but they know that if they can instantly kill the backline late game the cinderhulks dont matter... they just pressure early before they get built up and grab dragons then pop the backline until they 5 drag them and then they just win.

Since you brought up ratings I will point out that you are silver 2 I am gold 4. The patches influence what the meta becomes certainly. You are also correct in stating that broken stuff is discovered faster by the best players. You are also correct in stating that the meta would likely not change if their were no patch notes. However, Riot can't possible set down what people will actually play, their are just too many variables. For example, Riot never intended Warwick to be broken. They were trying to create a more diverse jungle meta. Instead the top players found out that Warwick with a particular item was horrible broken. In this case who is everyone emulating? Its the players. Another example, Riot discovered that mana regen was becoming problematic so they nerfed it across the board. What happened? The top player base discovered/theory crafted that manaless assassins would be good. People starting copying that. Who was everyone emulating? The top players. 

Basically it boils down to the fact that Riot is the catalyst for new metas but the players them selves actually decide what the meta will look like.

The meta changes when people win with something else.

So yeah, people copy winners.  Welcome to humanity.

Which was being theory-crafted by people other than the pros as soon as the idea hit PBE(so before the pros even had a chance to popularize it).  Pros don't truly set the meta because they're not even always the early adopters or popularizers.

Also, you fail to distinguish between "I found the good meta" and "I decide the good meta", which are functionally the same to those that follow trend-setters, but are distinctively different in other ways(and was the line MANBEARSWINE was pointing out).  In the former, the meta would be different if the pros played different, but in the latter, the meta would be the same more or less despite the pros.

Well honestly the reason I take the stance I do is because I believe to create something you have to be more or less cognitive of what you are creating. I don't believe Riot is always aware of what they are creating. I overall do agree with manbearswine. My conclusion is just slightly different for the above stated reason.

Except your above stated reason uses an example that runs contrary to fact. 

Fact 1:  -RIOT- decided that running smite on tanky champions was going to be stronger now by making cinderhulk.

Fact 2:  Pros didn't create/decide/discover the teleport/smite top laner meta.  That was theory-crafted publicly on reddit prior to Cinderhulk hitting live.

I can't imagine why you'd think pro players deserve the credit for that.

"Fact 1" Riot didn't decide that. Riot decided to try and make it so it would be unattractive for laners to buy jungle items by making you have smite and lose out on a combat summoner. People found out that the pay off was greater then the cost in that specific situation. Specifically with Cinderhulk Riot was trying to bring in more diversity into the jungle.

"Fact 2" I am unaware of the specifics of how tele smite became a thing but I never once said pros developed the meta. I did say top players developed it which would include people theory crafting as well as the pros.

I never said the pros deserved credit for it.

The "they" in the last quote can -only- mean "pros" by context.  The example of tele/smite is being attributed to -that- "they", meaning the "pros".  So again, *PLEASE*, keep your position internally consistent.  Either by conceding a point or by holding to your original one.  I can't really begin to have an actual conversation with you about the point otherwise at hand until you stop being inconsistent with what you said.

First quote the word usually makes a huge difference on the meaning of the sentence.

The last quote was poorly phrased and likely to cause confusion because I did not specifically state who the "they" in my post is. Although a little inconsistent you are being nit picky. I have one quote out of all of them that is slightly inconsistent.  You jump on that and make a big deal out of it. I can't begin to have a real conversation with you because you are more fixated on the grammar and phrasing and as such ignore the original point. Also you haven't particularly tried to have a conversation. Basically your point has been, your wrong because Riot makes the meta and your one post is worded poorly. 

If you agree with Manbearswine then me and you most likely mostly agree and just disagree on the conclusion. I believe that Riot has set the framework and the players have set the meta with in that framework. Specifically the top portion of the player base. Yours and manbearswine's opinion is that because Riot creates the framework that they inadvertently create meta's and the players just discover them. Functionally they are the same idea. I disagree with your opinion because I do not think that it is possible to create something as specific as a meta without intentionally doing so. The fact of the matter is that Riot's plans often times change things in unexpected ways and as such I don't believe it is Riot that creates the meta. 

There I saved you from the reading that it appears like you did not want to do.

1.I'm not being nitpicky, I'm interpreting pronouns in the only reasonable way I can.  If this poses a problem for understanding you, they're superfluous, you can make points without them, and be more clear for the effort.

2.I never said you said the word "only", only you did.  I ignored it precisely because I -wasn't- being nitpicky.  What I am being is someone trying to understand what you're saying, and what you've said were not making sense when interpreted reasonably.

3.To continue on point 1, if you don't want "they" to mean "pros", in that quote, what *DO* you want it to mean?  If you mean "top portion of the player base", could you elaborate?  What do you define as the top portion?  Diamond+?  Master+?  Challenger+Pros?  Please be specific enough so that I can tell what your position is.

4.Your opinion and mine are *NOT* functionally the same.  That's there's a key and fundamental difference between deciding something and discovering it.

5.Have you ever made a tie-dye shirt?  Even the best of the best can't fully control what they create, but they're the ones deciding and creating the shirt.  This is what I liken Riot's role to.  They're tie-dye shirt makers of a sort.  They put a rubber band here, a dip in blue dye there, and they're doing it intentionally, and for reasons, but the result is not 100% predictable, and sometimes, a shirt comes out wrong, but such is life.  Players, we're....honestly, I don't see much analogy out there, but what we're doing is finding and using tools.  We don't invent those tools, we find them.  Empire Nunu existed *LONG* before we called it that.  In-Sec didn't invent the play we name after him, I'm not even sure he discovered it, but he did popularize it.  Even things like tele/smite top has been a thing people of *ALL ELOS* have been looking at since forever, every time a promising change comes down the pipeline.  There's a reason smite-top WW/Fiora were ibiquitous immediately upon the launch of pre-season.  That never took off because Riot threw nerf after nerf at it until it stopped because top-smite-WW was stupid, but the idea was there.  When cinderhulk offered a stronger scaling option for top-smite, the conversation came back up(idk the rank fo the guy on reddit I saw theorycrafting it before everybody else, but he wasn't good enough to pull rank, so I'm assuming not challenger).  Sure, teleport is new, but its a logical transition on the champions using it.  Hecarim didn't really need flash, but top laners kinda do need teleport at the pro level and probably as far down as gold, so nobody is really surprised that this transition happened.

No.

They are figured out by the playerbase,but ultimately they are decided by riot(even if often unintentionally).
Urgot is as strong as he is right now not because players started playing him,but because riot gave him a mana ratio on his shield,lux isn't played right now not because players ignore her,but because riot refuses to buff her.

Riot simply isn't fully aware of the implications of the changes they make(which on it's own is fine,it's not an easy thing to do),but the players just discover things which are already there,whereas riot is the one creating said things(again,even if unintentionally).

Functionally I think are points our more or less the same. Ultimately Riot creates the possibility and the players discover it.

EDIT: Earlier I compared Riot to a catalyst and I stand by the comparison. Riot is part of the process and speeds up meta shifts but ultimately the players decide what the meta will be.

Another way of putting it. Riot crates the framework but the people inside the framework decide all the little details.

In a simplified way think of it this way: In patch there exists an optimal way(including picks/builds/etc) to play the game,riot isn't aware of it but the players do a decent job at trying to figure it out,but they aren't the ones deciding what way that is,that way already exist,all they do is try to find something which is already there.
Well I think our conclusions are just different.

The "Pro" meta is far from solo-que meta.

How often do you 2v1 lane swap?  Double jungle early?  4 man dive the top laner at 3:40?  Zone and proxy an entire wave with your team.

Place wards to scout for which lanes champions are going at 1:30~

You don't.  The game is far different for us than them.

Yet we see 1-1-1-2 in every ladder except for the very very top. Even at the top we have a system that functionally is the same but with just a slight variations. We got that because people that were good at the game discovered that lay out was the most efficient way to win and everyone else wanting to win started emulating it. We see minor changes all the time but it usually takes a while for it to filter down the ladder.

If this is about ranked, you're wrong. Sorry. Ranked is about playing the game competitively, not about playing your favorite champion. If you get the chance to, great! But don't expect it. Play to win. Play for the challenge. Just because you enjoy full AD Nasus in the jungle, doesn't make it a good idea when people are playing to win(yes there is a difference, and no that doesn't mean they're not playing for fun). Please don't take this as me saying don't have fun. Just don't go into ranked and do stupid stuff. Especially if you're lower ranked. You don't fully understand the game yet. You're not going to get away with full tank Teemo like a Diamond can.

Outside of this, yes. Play what you want. As long as you can preform that roll, you are doing nothing wrong. Knowing how to win the game will get you higher in rank than knowing how to do well on a champion. I'd even say mastering your champion is the least important thing you can do. Master your enemy, the map, then your own champion. Mastering your champion will only win you lane. How often do we see threads about "won lane, lost game, stupid team". 

In short, play what you enjoy while being respectful to those who have to play with you. Before you try to make ADC Brand a thing, you better understand the map and the enemy a bit better.
